de.sub.goobi.helper.tasks

Class LongRunningTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • de.sub.goobi.helper.tasks.EmptyTask
        • de.sub.goobi.helper.tasks.LongRunningTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INameableTask, Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CreatePdfFromServletThread
    Deprecated. 
    New task implementations should directly implement EmptyTask.

    @Deprecated
public abstract class LongRunningTask
extends EmptyTask
    Author:
    unascribed, Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>

      Deprecated. 
      The method setShowMessages() can be used to set a flag whether this long running task is executing asynchronously or not, in the latter case it shall show messages to the user using Helper.setMeldung(String), otherwise not.

      protected void setTitle(String title)
      Deprecated. 
      Replaced by EmptyTask.EmptyTask(String).
      protected void stopped()
      Deprecated. 
      The method stopped() has become redundant due to newer development. The thread state is now directly derived from Thread.getState() which is reliable in determining whether the thread has died, independent of whether it ever managed to call stopped() or died before.

        Deprecated. 

    • Constructor Detail

      • LongRunningTask

        @Deprecated
public LongRunningTask()
        Deprecated. New task implementations should directly implement EmptyTask.
        No-argument constructor. Creates an empty long running task. Must be made explicit because a constructor taking an argument is present.

      • LongRunningTask

        public LongRunningTask(LongRunningTask master)
        Deprecated. 
        The clone constructor creates a new instance of this object. This is necessary for Threads that have terminated in order to render to run them again possible.
        Parameters:
        master - copy master to create a clone of

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(Process inputProcess)
        Deprecated. 

      • setShowMessages

        public void setShowMessages(boolean show)
        Deprecated. 
        The method setShowMessages() can be used to set a flag whether this long running task is executing asynchronously or not, in the latter case it shall show messages to the user using Helper.setMeldung(String), otherwise not.
        Parameters:
        show - whether to show messages to the user

      • cancel

        @Deprecated
public void cancel()
        Deprecated. Replaced by Thread.interrupt().

      • replace

        public abstract EmptyTask replace()
        Deprecated. 
        Calls the clone constructor to create a not yet executed instance of this thread object. This is necessary for threads that have terminated in order to render possible to restart them.
        Overrides:
        replace in class EmptyTask
        Returns:
        a not-yet-executed replacement of this thread
        See Also:
        EmptyTask.replace()

      • stopped

        @Deprecated
protected void stopped()
        Deprecated. The method stopped() has become redundant due to newer development. The thread state is now directly derived from Thread.getState() which is reliable in determining whether the thread has died, independent of whether it ever managed to call stopped() or died before.
        The method stopped() had been used to record that the thread has stopped.
